title: Leftwards Arrow with Hook

verbs: To change direction or course suddenly; to swerve.
Change orientation or direction, also in the abstract sense
To change one's direction of travel.
To go back to a previous state by reversing the effects of one or more commands.
To reverse the action of selecting a range of text or objects.
Cancel, annul, or reverse an action or its effect
To reverse the effects of an action.
To revoke an action. To quit an action without saving any changes that the action would result in.
Communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
nouns: A mark to indicate a direction or relation
A mark to indicate a direction or relation.
A sign or symbol used to indicate a direction (e.g. \to).
The human back is the large posterior area of the human body, rising from the top of the buttocks to the back of the neck and the shoulders.
The rear of the body, especially the part between the neck and the end of the spine and opposite the chest and belly.
The large posterior area of the human body, rising from the top of the buttocks to the back of the neck and the shoulders
The posterior part of a human (or animal) body from the neck to the end of the spine
The rear of body, especially the part between the neck and the end of the spine and opposite the chest and belly.
Complete reversal of direction of travel
A U-turn in driving refers to performing a 180 degree rotation to reverse the direction of travel.
Change of the direction of a movement into the opposed direction.
A reversal of policy; a volte-face, a backflip

description: An arrow pointing to the left, with a curved hook at the other end. Similar in appearance to a sideways U Turn symbol, or a reply icon in an email application.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the right arrow curving left emoji is depicted as a vibrant, glossy stroke that elegantly transitions from a confident rightward direction to a graceful sweep back to the left. Its smooth gradients and precise, rounded edges convey a sense of fluid motion and deliberate redirection, a visual cue for changing course or indicating a return. This Apple-rendered icon is ideal for signaling a pivot in thought, a step backward, or navigating through options on a screen.
